title: Wedding of Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox and Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: Our Love Story
text:
Our Love Story
It was our dedication to nerdiness that first brought us together in the autumn of 2019. Being the only two new PhD students at our department, we naturally gravitated towards each other and soon discovered a shared love of silly shenanigans and Noam Chomsky. Before long, we realised that we had an almost eerily number of things in common ‚Äì we both felt emotionally and culturally connected to the UK and Denmark, we both played the violin, and both were passionately interested in language and the mind. The feeling of being understood at so many levels felt magical.
A few months after we met, Johanne plucked up the courage to tell Chris that she liked him in a ‚Äúnon-platonic‚Äù way. To nobody else‚Äôs great surprise and to all of our guests‚Äô luck next summer, he reciprocated. The relationship took off like a rocket, largely thanks to a certain pandemic that prevented us from spending most of our first year separately abroad for research stays and conferences. A year after we got together, we bought our flat in Aarhus and started our blissful co-existence. Aarhus became our base for many adventures both together and separately, and soon it will function as our base for building a family.

title: Wedding of Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox and Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: What we envision for our wedding day
text:
What we envision for our wedding day
For a long time, we‚Äôve both dreamed of bringing together all the wonderful people we‚Äôve met during our adventures through time and space ‚Äî from high school friends to AirBnB hosts, childhood buddies to crazy cousins. Our hope is to create a laid-back, informal atmosphere filled with music, games, and all sorts of entertainment.
Some parts of the celebration will be in English, and others in Danish. If any of our non-Danish guests look a bit confused, we kindly ask our Danish friends to help out and explain what‚Äôs going on.
Children are more than welcome (we‚Äôll probably have our one with us!), and we‚Äôve planned some fun activities for them, like treasure hunts and other games.
Expect plenty of fun, delicious food, and a dance floor that will stay busy well into the night. From the moment you arrive, we want you to feel welcome and hope you feel the joy and excitement we‚Äôre feeling. Most of all, we just want everyone to have a fantastic time celebrating this fun time in our lives!

title: Wedding of Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox and Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: What will be happening on the day?
text: What will be happening on the day?

title: Wedding of Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox and Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: Where is Thy? And how do I get there?
text:
Where is Thy? And how do I get there?
Thy is an area in the north west of Jutland known for its unbelievably beautiful, raw, and unique natural environment. This was where Johanne was lucky enough to grow up and we‚Äôve always thought that it would be the perfect place to celebrate our wedding.
There are two main locations to be aware of:

Wedding Ceremony (where we say ‚ÄúI do‚Äù and try not to cry too much) ‚Äì at N√∏rh√• Church, Morten Nielsens Vej 11, 7752 Snedsted.
Celebration at L√¶rkely in a big circus tent - at L√¶rkely, Kalkv√¶rksvej 20, 7752 Snedsted.







For the international guests, you may be thinking: how on Earth am I going to get to Thy and where am I going to stay? If you‚Äôre arriving in Denmark by plane, the easiest destination would be Billund Lufthavn. From there, you can rent a car, or take a three-hour train to Snedsted where we‚Äôll come and pick you up.

title: Wedding of Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox and Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: Where can we stay in Stenbjerg, Thy?
text:
Where can we stay in Stenbjerg, Thy?
Stenbjerg is a small place (just to give you an idea, there wasn‚Äôt even electricity there until the 1970s). We have therefore secured deals with almost all available accommodation within a 5km radius of L√¶rkely. Specifically, we have arranged accommodation at the following cozy places at a flat rate of 350kr.:

Stenbjerg Kro.
Stone Mountain Bed & Breakfast.
Fiskerhuset Bed & Breakfast.
Strandfogedg√•rden (700kr. for 14 people).
Stay with a Thy Local (Annette or Lisbeth).
2 AirBnbs.

If you know that you need accommodation when arriving in Thy, let us know and we will arrange it for you as well as transport to and from L√¶rkely.

title: Wedding of Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox and Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: What about presents?
text:
What about presents?
We want no other presents than your presence. We‚Äôre just so happy to have you with us to celebrate. A lot of you are travelling from afar ‚Äì be it from India, England, or even Copenhagen!

title: Wedding of Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox and Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: Dresscode
text:
Dresscode
We‚Äôre aiming for a ‚Äòdress to impress‚Äô vibe - stylish yet comfortable! The main celebrations will be in a tent (with heating). Whether it‚Äôs a sharp outfit or a beautiful ensemble, we trust you‚Äôll strike the perfect balance for the day with a look that suits both the celebration and the weather.

title: Programme
section: What will be happening on the day?
text:
What will be happening on the day?
We‚Äôve got a day packed with love and celebration, and we‚Äôre so excited to share it with you! Here‚Äôs what you can expect:

Ceremony ‚Äì Where we say ‚ÄúI do‚Äù and try not to cry too much.
We drive to Kalv√¶rksvej ‚Äì A fun 4-minute road trip to our next destination.
We Party Hard ‚Äì You know what this means. Bring your best dance moves and let‚Äôs make this a night to remember!

title: Programme
section: Where can we stay in Thy?
text:
Where can we stay in Thy?
Thy is filled with lovely places to stay, and we‚Äôve gathered a few recommendations just for you! Here are some cozy spots we think you‚Äôll love:

[Hotel Thy Comfort Inn] ‚Äì For a comfortable stay right in the heart of the action.
[Pine Tree Lodge] ‚Äì Perfect if you love a bit of nature and serenity.
[The Cozy Cabin] ‚Äì A cute and charming spot for those who want a peaceful retreat.

Feel free to reach out to them directly to book your stay!

title: Programme
section: What about presents?
text:
What about presents?
Honestly, we‚Äôre just so happy to have you with us to celebrate! But if you insist‚Ä¶ we won‚Äôt say no to presents. üòÑ We‚Äôve put together a little list of things we‚Äôd love (or, you know, need) as we start this next adventure together: LINK TO WEBSITE! Here‚Äôs our wish list, and yes, we‚Äôll gladly accept all of them, thank you very much!

title: Acknowledgments
text: This repo and GitHub Action was based on the tutorial by Openscapes quarto-website-tutorial by Julia Lowndes and Stefanie Butland.

title: Rendering
text:
The repo includes a GitHub Action that will render (build) the website automatically when you make changes to the files. It will be pushed to the gh-pages branch.
But when you are developing your content, you will want to render it locally.

title: Rendering
section: Step 1. Make sure you have a recent RStudio
text:
Step 1. Make sure you have a recent RStudio
Have you updated RStudio since about August 2022? No? Then update to a newer version of RStudio. In general, you want to keep RStudio updated and it is required to have a recent version to use Quarto.

title: Rendering
section: Step 2. Clone and create RStudio project
text:
Step 2. Clone and create RStudio project
First, clone the repo onto your local computer. How? You can click File > New Project and then select ‚ÄúVersion Control‚Äù. Paste in the url of the repository. That will clone the repo on to your local computer. When you make changes, you will need to push those up.

title: Rendering
section: Step 3. Render within RStudio
text:
Step 3. Render within RStudio
RStudio will recognize that this is a Quarto project by the presence of the _quarto.yml file and will see the ‚ÄúBuild‚Äù tab. Click the ‚ÄúRender website‚Äù button to render to the _site folder.
Previewing: You can either click index.html in the _site folder and specify ‚Äúpreview in browser‚Äù or set up RStudio to preview to the viewer panel. To do the latter, go to Tools > Global Options > R Markdown. Then select ‚ÄúShow output preview in: Viewer panel‚Äù.

title: Bryllup mellem  Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox  &  Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: Vores K√¶rlighedshistorie
text:
Vores K√¶rlighedshistorie
Det hele startede med et tilf√¶ldigt m√∏de en bl√¶sende eftermiddag om efter√•ret. Chris, altid en gentleman, havde en kaffe i den ene h√•nd og en stak b√∏ger i den anden, da han pludselig ‚Äì bam ‚Äì st√∏dte lige ind i Johanne. Kaffen fl√∏j, b√∏gerne v√¶ltede, og sk√¶bnen, som man siger, var beseglet.
Fra det √∏jeblik vidste Chris, at Johanne var noget helt s√¶rligt. Han blev betaget af hendes glimtende √∏jne, smittende latter og den m√•de, hun smilede p√•, selv n√•r hans klodsethed var tydelig. Johanne kunne heller ikke undg√• at blive charmeret af Chris‚Äô akavede, men s√∏de fors√∏g p√• at g√∏re det godt igen efter den spildte kaffe ‚Äì og det f√∏rte til deres f√∏rste officielle date.
Den date blev til mange flere, fyldt med latter, eventyr og lange samtaler om alt fra dr√∏mme til pizzafyld (de diskuterer stadig fordelene ved ananas!). Sammen opdagede de deres k√¶rlighed til spontane roadtrips, natlige dansefester i k√∏kkenet og maratonvisninger af d√•rlige romantiske komedier.
Efter utallige minder og en k√¶rlighed, der kun blev st√¶rkere, besluttede Chris at fri p√• den mest Chris-agtige m√•de: mens han fors√∏gte (og fejlede) at lave Johannes livret. Hun sagde ja mellem bidder af let br√¶ndt pasta, og resten, som man siger, er historie.
Nu inviterer vi jer til at fejre det n√¶ste kapitel i vores k√¶rlighedshistorie, n√•r vi siger ‚Äúja‚Äù og begynder vores evige eventyr sammen. Hvad vi forestiller os for vores bryllupsdag
Vi √∏nsker, at vores bryllupsdag skal v√¶re fyldt med k√¶rlighed, latter og uforglemmelige √∏jeblikke. Fra det √∏jeblik, I ankommer, til den sidste dans, h√•ber vi, at I vil m√¶rke den gl√¶de og sp√¶nding, vi f√∏ler. Forvent masser af sjov, l√¶kker mad og et dansegulv, der vil v√¶re fyldt langt ud p√• natten. Mest af alt √∏nsker vi bare, at alle har en fantastisk tid med at fejre dette s√¶rlige kapitel i vores liv! Hvad skal der ske p√• dagen?
Vi har en dag pakket med k√¶rlighed og fest, og vi gl√¶der os s√• meget til at dele den med jer! Her er, hvad I kan forvente:

Ceremoni ‚Äì Hvor vi siger ‚Äúja‚Äù og pr√∏ver at lade v√¶re med at gr√¶de for meget.








Vi k√∏rer til Kalkv√¶rksvej 20 ‚Äì En sjov 4-minutters roadtrip til vores n√¶ste destination.








Vi fester igennem ‚Äì Du ved, hvad det betyder. Tag dine bedste dansetrin med, og lad os g√∏re denne aften uforglemmelig!

title: Bryllup mellem  Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox  &  Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: Hvor kan vi overnatte i Thy?
text:
Hvor kan vi overnatte i Thy?
Thy er fyldt med dejlige steder at overnatte, og vi har samlet nogle anbefalinger til jer! Her er nogle hyggelige steder, vi tror, I vil elske:

[Hotel Thy Comfort Inn] ‚Äì For et komfortabelt ophold lige midt i begivenhedernes centrum.
[Pine Tree Lodge] ‚Äì Perfekt, hvis du elsker lidt natur og ro.
[The Cozy Cabin] ‚Äì Et s√∏dt og charmerende sted for dem, der √∏nsker en fredfyldt oase.

Kontakt dem gerne direkte for at booke jeres ophold!

title: Bryllup mellem  Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox  &  Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd
section: Hvad med gaver?
text:
Hvad med gaver?
√Ürligt talt er vi bare s√• glade for at have jer med til at fejre! Men hvis I insisterer‚Ä¶ vi siger ikke nej til gaver. üòÑ Vi har lavet en lille liste med ting, vi ville elske (eller, du ved, har brug for) til vores n√¶ste eventyr sammen: LINK TIL WEBSITE! Her er vores √∏nskeliste, og ja, vi tager gladeligt imod dem alle, tak!

title: Bryllup mellem  Christopher Martin Mikkelsen Cox  &  Johanne Sofie Krog Nederg√•rd

Dresscode
Tag hatte og jakkes√¶t p√•, baby!

title: Publishing
text:
To get your Quarto webpage to show up with the url
you have a few steps.

title: Publishing
section: Turn on GitHub Pages for your repo
text:
Turn on GitHub Pages for your repo

Turn on GitHub Pages under Settings > Pages . You will set pages to be made from the gh-pages branch and the root directory.
Turn on GitHub Actions under Settings > Actions > General

The GitHub Action will automatically recreate your website when you push to GitHub after you do the initial gh-pages set-up

title: Publishing
section: Do your first publish to gh-pages
text:
Do your first publish to gh-pages
The first time you publish to gh-pages, you need to do so locally.

On your local computer, open a terminal window and cd to your repo directory. Here is what that cd command looks like for me. You command will look different because your local repo will be somewhere else on your computer.

cd ~/Documents/GitHub/NOAA-quarto-simple

Publish to the gh-pages. In the terminal type

quarto publish gh-pages
This is going to render your webpage and then push the _site contents to the gh-pages branch.

title: Publishing
section: Don‚Äôt like using gh-pages?
text:
Don‚Äôt like using gh-pages?
In some cases, you don‚Äôt want your website on the gh-pages branch. For example, if you are creating releases and you want the website pages archived in that release, then you won‚Äôt want your website pages on the gh-pages branch.
Here are the changes you need to make if you to avoid gh-pages branch.

At the top of _quarto.yml add the following:

project: 
  type: website
  output-dir: docs

On GitHub under Settings > Pages set pages to be made from the main branch and the docs directory.
Make sure docs is not listed in .gitignore
Publish the site the first time locally using quarto publish from the terminal
Change the GitHub Action because you can‚Äôt use quarto publish gh-pages. You‚Äôll need to push to the main branch yourself (in the GitHub Action)

on:
  push:
    branches: main

name: Render and Publish

jobs:
  build-deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    env:
      GITHUB_PAT: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

    steps:
      - name: Check out repository
        uses: actions/checkout@v2 
        
      - name: Set up R (needed for Rmd)
        uses: r-lib/actions/setup-r@v2

      - name: Install packages (needed for Rmd)
        run: Rscript -e 'install.packages(c("rmarkdown", "knitr", "jsonlite"))'

      - name: Set up Quarto
        uses: quarto-dev/quarto-actions/setup@v2
        with:
          # To install LaTeX to build PDF book 
          # tinytex: true 
          # uncomment below and fill to pin a version
          # version: 0.9.600
      
      - name: Render Quarto Project
        uses: quarto-dev/quarto-actions/render@v2
        with:
          to: html

      - name: Set up Git
        run: |
          git config --local user.email "actions@github.com"
          git config --local user.name "GitHub Actions"

      - name: Commit all changes and push
        run: |
          git add -A && git commit -m 'Build site' || echo "No changes to commit"
          git push origin || echo "No changes to commit"

title: Rendering with Code
text:
You can have code (R, Python or Julia) in your qmd file. You will need to have these installed on your local computer, but presumably you do already if you are adding code to your qmd files.
x <- c(5, 15, 25, 35, 45, 55)
y <- c(5, 20, 14, 32, 22, 38)
lm(x ~ y)


Call:
lm(formula = x ~ y)

Coefficients:
(Intercept)            y  
      1.056        1.326

title: Rendering with Code
section: Modify the GitHub Action
text:
Modify the GitHub Action
You will need to change the GitHub Action in .github/workflows to install these and any needed packages in order for GitHub to be able to render your webpage. The GitHub Action install R since I used that in code.qmd. If you use Python or Julia instead, then you will need to update the GitHub Action to install those.
If getting the GitHub Action to work is too much hassle (and that definitely happens), you can alway render locally and publish to the gh-pages branch. If you do this, make sure to delete or rename the GitHub Action to something like
render-and-publish.old_yml
so GitHub does not keep trying to run it. Nothing bad will happen if you don‚Äôt do this, but if you are not using the action (because it keeps failing), then you don‚Äôt need GitHub to run it.

title: Rendering with Code
section: Render locally and publish to gh-pages branch
text:
Render locally and publish to gh-pages branch
To render locally and push up to the gh-pages branch, open a terminal window and then cd to the directory with the Quarto project. Type this in the terminal:
quarto render gh-pages

title: R Markdown
text: You can include R Markdown files in your project.

title: R Markdown
section: R Markdown
text:
R Markdown
This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

summary(cars)

     speed           dist       
 Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00  
 1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00  
 Median :15.0   Median : 36.00  
 Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98  
 3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00  
 Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

title: R Markdown
section: Including Plots
text:
Including Plots
You can also embed plots, for example:









Note that the echo = FALSE parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.

title: Customization
text: Quarto allow many bells and whistles to make nice output. Read the documentation here Quarto documentation.

title: Customization
text: Quarto allow many bells and whistles to make nice output. Read the documentation here Quarto documentation.

title: Customization
section: Examples
text:
Examples
Looking at other people‚Äôs Quarto code is a great way to figure out how to do stuff. Most will have a link to a GitHub repo where you can see the raw code. Look for a link to edit page or see source code. This will usually be on the right. Or look for the GitHub icon somewhere.

Quarto gallery
nmfs-openscapes
Faye lab manual
quarto-titlepages Note the link to edit is broken. Go to repo and look in documentation directory.
